metadata.title: CVE-2016-9902 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Pocket toolbar button, once activated, listens for events fired fromit's own pages but does not verify the origin of incoming events. Thisallows content from other origins to fire events and inject content andcommands into the Pocket context. Note: this issue does not affect userswith e10s enabled. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 45.6 andFirefox < 50.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
